twcore.core
Class BotQueue

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      twcore.core.BotQueue
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class BotQueue
extends java.lang.Thread

Separate thread that holds a queue of bots to be spawned, spawns them when ready, and maintains a reference to every spawned bot. Handles bot removal as necessary. Also ensures that spawning limits for each type of bot are enforced.

Nested Class Summary
 class BotQueue.ChildBot
          Internal class abstraction used to store information about bots that have been spawned from a HubBot.

Constructor Detail

BotQueue

BotQueue(java.lang.ThreadGroup group,
         BotAction botAction)
Initializes necessary data and recursively sets up a bot repository for the AdaptiveClassLoader to load from. Also sets the spawn delay between bots to a low value if the bots are being spawned locally.

Parameters:
group - The thread grouping to which the queue belongs
botAction - Reference to a BotAction instantiation
Method Detail

resetRepository

public void resetRepository()
Clears the current repository and adds the core location and all subdirectories to the current bot repository.

getNumberOfBots

int getNumberOfBots(java.lang.String className)
Returns the total number of bots of a given class.

Parameters:
className - Name of the class of bots
Returns:
Number of bots of the class

listWaitingList

void listWaitingList(java.lang.String messager)
Displays the contents of the current bot spawning queue in PM to the specified player.

Parameters:
messager - Name of the player who will receive the message

listBotTypes

void listBotTypes(java.lang.String messager)
Lists the number of bots of each currently spawned type to the specified player in PM. If for some reason the count is 0 or less, the result is not displayed.

Parameters:
messager - Name of the player who will receive the message

listBots

void listBots(java.lang.String className,
              java.lang.String messager)
Lists the login names of all bots of a particular class name to the specified player in PM.

Parameters:
className - Class of bots in question
messager - Name of the player who will receive the message

addToBotCount

void addToBotCount(java.lang.String className,
                   int valueToAdd)
Increments the count of a particular class of bots with a specified value.

Parameters:
className - Class of bots to increment the count of
valueToAdd - Amount to add

getFreeBotNumber

int getFreeBotNumber(BotSettings botInfo)
Returns the next free bot number of a class of bots, given the bot's settings.

Parameters:
botInfo - Settings for the particular bot type
Returns:
Next free bot number of this class of bots

removeBot

boolean removeBot(java.lang.String name)
Given the login name of a bot, removes it from the system.

Parameters:
name - Login name of bot to remove
Returns:
True if removal succeeded

hardRemoveAllBotsOfType

void hardRemoveAllBotsOfType(java.lang.String className)
Removes all bots of a given type. For debug purposes, or the impatient.

Parameters:
className - Class of bots to remove

spawnBot

void spawnBot(java.lang.String className,
              java.lang.String messager)
Spawns a bot into existence based on a given class name. In order to be spawned, the class must exist, the CFG must exist and be properly formed, and the maximum number of bots of the type allowed must be less than the number currently active.

Parameters:
className - Class name of bot to spawn
messager - Name of player trying to spawn the bot

run

public void run()
Queue thread execution loop. Attempts to spawn the next bot on the waiting list, if the proper delay time has been reached.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

addDirectories

public void addDirectories(java.io.File base)
Recursively adds all subdirectories of a given base directory to the repository, and adds the base directory itself.

Parameters:
base - Directory from which to start
